title: Ligne Roset logo
content: There are some very un-typographic qualities to it, like the way it's perfectly geometric and doesn't compensate for optical effects. I don't think it's based on any font. You could reproduce it with a compass and a straight-edge and I suspect that's how it was done.
author: Mark Simonson

comments.content:
Mark,   
This french brand exist for almost 20 years, and the printed version is not like that from what I recall. The image posted by Stephen show a perfect example of medium limits.   
   
   
I just found that:   
 [http://www.ligne-roset.tm.fr/photoAgrandie.php?image=images/Content/logo-roset-d\_hier.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20051127114108/http:/www.ligne-roset.tm.fr/photoAgrandie.php?image=images/Content/logo-roset-d_hier.jpg)   
   
From that brand history page:   
 [http://www.ligne-roset.tm.fr/page.php?P=bases/Accueil/Ligne\_Roset/Histoire\_LigneRoset/&Filename=item\_Historique\_07072001\_994531761](http://web.archive.org/web/20051127114108/http:/www.ligne-roset.tm.fr/page.php?P=bases/Accueil/Ligne_Roset/Histoire_LigneRoset/&Filename=item_Historique_07072001_994531761)
